channel.title: Finance
channel.description: Latest investing news and finance headlines straight from Wall Street.

item.title: Amazon to stop accepting Visa credit cards issued in the UK, citing high fees
item.description: Amazon has told some customers that, from Jan. 19 2022 onward, the company will no longer accept Visa credit cards issued in Britain.

item.title: Ray Dalio's Bridgewater is reportedly looking to raise $469 million in new China fund
item.description: American hedge fund manager Ray Dalio is launching a new China fund through a local subsidiary, according to China's Securities Times, citing sources.

item.title: Stock futures little changed after Lowe's and Target post earnings beats
item.description: Stock futures were little changed in early morning trading on Wednesday following earnings reports from big-box retailers Target and Lowe's.

item.title: Child tax credit may plunge to $1,000 from $3,600 per kid after 2025
item.description: The tax break for parents is poised to revert to its level before the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act unless Congress intervenes.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Home Depot, Robinhood, SoFi and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: UK software firm Blue Prism soars 10% on potential bidding war
item.description: Shares of Blue Prism surged Tuesday after the British software company received a higher takeover offer from U.S.-based tech firm SS&C Technologies Holdings.

item.title: Same-sex couples in certain states may get a tax break from Democrats’ $1.75 trillion social plan
item.description: The Build Back Better Act would let same-sex married couples in some states file a joint tax return for years before 2010, which might yield a net tax benefit.

item.title: Credit card start-up Upgrade jumps 83% in valuation in just four months to $6.28 billion
item.description: Upgrade is the latest company to benefit from the "buy now, pay later" trend in fintech.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves in the premarket: Rackspace Technology, Axon Enterprise, Royalty Pharma and more
item.description: The stocks making the biggest moves in premarket trading include Rackspace Technology, Axon Enterprise, Royalty Pharma, and more.

item.title: Wall Street bankers and traders are in line for the biggest bonus increases since 2009
item.description: The sharp rebound in business activity this year has translated to unprecedented workloads for Wall Street professionals — and a competitive job market.

item.title: El-Erian says he bought bitcoin but sold too early — here's when he'd feel comfortable buying again
item.description: Allianz's Mohamed El-Erian says he purchased an unspecified amount of bitcoin when it plunged close to $3,000 in the "crypto winter" of 2018.

item.title: Biden-Xi virtual meeting ends with both sides calling for more cooperation amid tensions
item.description: The leaders ended the meeting shortly before 12:30 p.m. Beijing time (11:30 p.m. ET Monday), almost four hours after it began, according to Chinese state media.

item.title: Fed should hike interest rates immediately to cut stagflation risks, economist Stephen Roach suggests
item.description: If rising prices aren't contained quickly, former Federal Reserve economist Stephen Roach warns inflation could morph into stagflation.

item.title: S&P 500 rises after strong retail data, Home Depot leads Dow higher
item.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average gained after better-than-expected results from Home Depot.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Boeing, Dollar Tree, Tesla and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves in the premarket: Oatly, Tesla, Dollar Tree and more
item.description: The stocks making the biggest moves in premarket trading include Oatly, Tesla, Dollar Tree, and more.

item.title: Stocks close flat to start the week ahead of big retail earnings
item.description: U.S. equities were flat Monday, as U.S. Treasury yields climbed higher and investors awaited quarterly reports from big retailers later in the week.

item.title: Top tech investor Paul Meeks won’t put new money to work in Apple and other FAANG names, blames chip shortage that could extend through 2023
item.description: Paul Meeks, who ran the world’s largest tech fund during the dot-com bubble, suggests Wall Street is underestimating supply chain backlogs.

item.title: Quit a job? You likely can't collect unemployment benefits
item.description: Americans are quitting their jobs in record numbers. They generally can't count on unemployment benefits as a financial buffer.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Tesla, Lordstown Motors, Warby Parker and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Johnson & Johnson, Rivian, Lordstown and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

item.title: China slams U.S. democracy as a 'game of the rich,' at an event promoting Xi's growing power
item.description: The remarks come as Chinese President Xi Jinping became the third leader to oversee the politically significant approval of a "historical resolution" this week.

item.title: Central bank digital currencies are a long way from becoming reality — unless you’re in China
item.description: Rising interest in cryptocurrencies has reignited central banks' digital currency ambitions. But so far, most CBDC projects are moving at a sluggish pace.

item.title: Experts say the 4% rule, a popular retirement income strategy, is outdated
item.description: Average stock and bond returns aren't expected to be as robust in coming decades, and retirees may have to reduce withdrawals from their nest eggs.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Rivian, Beyond Meat, Disney and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

item.title: Major Wall Street firm has one of its largest equity overweights ever - and is looking to buy even more stocks
item.description: Wilmington Trust's Meghan Shue explains why her firm has been piling into stocks and what she would buy on weakness.

item.title: Nasdaq rebounds after inflation-driven sell-off, Disney weighs on the Dow
item.description: The Nasdaq Composite rebounded Thursday after hot inflation data and surging bond yields sparked a sell-off in technology stocks in the previous session.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Disney, Beyond Meat, Affirm Holdings and more
item.description: See which stocks are posting big moves after the bell on Wednesday.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Mastercard, Unity Software, Wendy's and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: McKinsey partner is charged with insider trading tied to Goldman Sachs' acquisition of GreenSky
item.description: A federal complaint unsealed Wednesday charges McKinsey partner Puneet Dikshit with insider trading in his client Goldman Sachs' acquisition of GreenSky.
